messages.title: West Berkshire is thriving
messages.content: West Berkshire has enjoyed a prolonged period of financial growth due to the successful Conservative economic policies of Government, with unemployment set to remain at a 40-year low.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring the availability of mental health services is crucial. The Conservative government will invest in mental health services through the additional funding that they allocated.
95% of schools are good or outstanding, and support will continue for welcoming School in Berkshire.
Affordable housing for young people, ensuring young people won't have to leave the area in order to sustain their work and can retain talent in West Berkshire.
Champion local businesses, drive local economy with increased connectivity, and improve skills.
Support frequent Rail to increase the commuter links to Reading and London, and work with local authorities to increase the connectivity to West Berkshire.
Get Brexit done, as the uncertainty surrounding Brexit is causing problems for the economy and governance.

issues.brexitEurope: Get Brexit done – so we can finally get on with the life priorities.
issues.economy: West Berkshire has enjoyed a prolonged period of financial growth due to the successful Conservative economic policies, with unemployment remaining low.
issues.education: 95% of our schools are good or outstanding. The Prime Minister's pledge to add funding is welcome for schools in West Berkshire.
issues.environment: The Conservative Party has always championed businesses that not only win for entrepreneurship, but also ensure they protect our environment.

housing.content: Need to ensure there is enough affordable housing for young people.

images.caption: Laura Farris campaign images depicting various activities and interactions with the public.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet criticizes the Liberal Democrats and their leader Jo Swinson for potentially creating more confusion around Brexit.
